title: The Plague
description:
Welcome to The Plague, the podcast where we look, not just at the ongoing coronavirus pandemic, but at our nation’s home-made plagues, plagues created by human socioeconomic systems, that make the coronavirus more virulent and dangerous.

The coronavirus infects the human body, but what illnesses in our body politic make us more vulnerable to it?

Economic inequality? Environmental devastation? Labor precarity? Alienation? We pick a different societal plague each week and talk with an expert about how that plague makes the coronavirus deadlier.

We then move on to discuss “treatments” or even “cures” for that plague: what kinds of political or cultural action we can take to “cure” it. Since many of our guest experts are also artists, they are invited to share a creative work on the topic—a song, poem, monologue—of their own creation or choosing.

Guests include poet and Friends of the Earth organizer Jeff Conant, Dr. Rupa Marya of the Do No Harm Coalition and the band Rupa and the April Fishes, performance artists Annie Sprinkle and Beth Stephens, theatre activist Aryeh Shell, affordable medicine activist Merith Basey, playwright and San Francisco Mime Troupe member Michael Gene Sullivan, and many more.

Your host, L.M. Bogad, broadcasts from his “shelter in place” bunker, while himself conspiring in ongoing creative activist campaigns on these issues.

The Plague Podcast:

Created, Hosted, Edited by L.M. Bogad (www.lmbogad.com), professor of political performance at UC Davis, and author of the books Tactical Performance and Electoral Guerrila Theatre, and the play COINTELSHOW: A Patriot Act.

Music by Jason Montero (https://m.soundcloud.com/jamoja) and Bogad’s Other Friend Named Jay. Logo by Bogad, with clip art from nicepng.com.

For more information on L.M. Bogad's books and performance work: www.lmbogad.com.

L.M. Bogad is an author, performance artist, professor of political performance at U.C. Davis, and co-founder of the Clandestine Insurgent Rebel Clown Army. He has performed and led workshops in mischievous activist pranks internationally, most recently in Argentina, Brazil, Chile, Latvia, at SFMOMA and other major museums, on a squatted military base in Barcelona, and in Cairo during the first phase of the Egyptian revolution. He was the “Art and Controversy” Fellow, and the Distinguished Lecturer on Performance and Politics, at Carnegie Mellon University, and the “Humanities and Political Conflict” Fellow at Arizona State University. His projects includes a historical role playing game called “Possible Pasts,” and performances which excavate and explore the memories of historical confrontations including the Haymarket Square Riot, the Pinochet coup, and the FBI’s COINTELPRO activities. His books are Electoral Guerilla Theatre: Radical Ridicule and Social Movements, Tactical Performance: The Theory and Practice of Serious Play, and COINTELSHOW: A Patriot Act and the forthcoming Perform/Inform/Transform: Works of Radical Memory for Times of Social Amnesia..

title: The MimeCast
description:
The MimeCast is a series of biographical podcast interviews of current and veteran members of the Tony and OBIE award-winning, and despite its name never, ever silent San Francisco Mime Troupe, “America's Foremost Theatre of Political Comedy."  For the past 60 years the  Mime Troupe has brought its brand of revolutionary theater to audiences across the country and around the world. 

Their original musical comedies, and some dramas, but mainly comedies, have tackled social,  economic, and environmental justice, civil rights, workers rights, gender equality, oppression at home and abroad, and how capitalism is essentially antithetical to democracy. 

Hundreds of artists, actors, designers, writers, directors, composers, lyricists, and choreographers have helped the Mime Troupe inform, entertain, and stir up the working class over the decades, and the MimeCast is a chance to get to know some of them a little bit better￼. 

Hosted by SFMT member Michael Gene Sullivan

title: Nieuwe Vide Radio
description:
Nieuwe Vide is een kunstpodium en broedplaats, en is ontstaan uit de kraakbeweging. Vandaag de dag bouwen we voort op de activistische idealen en DIY-mentaliteit die aan de basis lagen van onze instelling. Vanuit deze wortels zoeken we constant naar manieren om kunst en maatschappij met elkaar te verbinden, met als kloppend hart onze community in de broedplaats. We zijn verbonden met elkaar door kunst, maar ook door eten en gezelligheid.

We verbinden op een laagdrempelige manier de onderwerpen en theorieën die ons inspireren met het alledaagse en herkenbare. We werken vanuit de overtuiging dat kunst ons kan helpen om na te denken over nieuwe manieren om de wereld te bekijken en in te richten. Graag gaan we zelfs nog een stap verder dan hierover nadenken, en proberen we de ideeën die we bespreken ook dagelijks in de praktijk te brengen. We verzetten ons tegen de patriarchale norm die in onze maatschappij nog steeds leidend is, en stellen in plaats daarvan collectiviteit, waardering, zorg, overleg en emotie centraal. Daarbij haken we aan op actuele onderwerpen, zoals kapitalisme, feminisme en digitale cultuur, en zijn we niet bang om mee te veranderen met de tijd.

title: Budoucnost divadla
description: Když se nemůže divadlo hrát, nabízí tento unikátní odstup alespoň možnost divadlo reflektovat. V mnoha textech a rozhovorech o budoucnosti divadla se mluví o takzvané třetí divadelní reformě. Pojem navazuje na myšlení Kazimierze Brauna, který za první divadelní reformu označoval proměnu divadla na přelomu 19. a 20. století a za druhou dění spjaté s kontrakulturním hnutím šedesátých let. Jaký by měl být charakter třetí divadelní reformy – dnes, v časech, kdy pandemie koronaviru naplnila vizi Heinera Müllera, jenž vybízel divadla na rok zavřít, abychom pochopili jejich hodnotu? Dá se začít tam, kde jsme skončili? Jaké jsou nejzajímavější koncepty a nástroje, kterými můžeme začít revizi divadla? A je divadlo ve svém posledním tažení, nebo se naopak může stát po filmu, který ovládl 20. století, vůdčím druhem umění pro svoji neredukovatelnost do online prostoru? Co jsou otázky divadla budoucnosti? A proč divadlo potřebujeme? Kolektiv HaDivadla vytvořil tento podcast ve snaze sdílet rozhovory o budoucnosti divadla s lidmi, s nimiž se rádi o divadle bavíme. Příjemný poslech! — www.hadivadlo.cz

title: Huismus Podcast
description:
Drie jonge goden, in de bloei van hun leven worden door Covid omgetoverd tot huismussen. Daar waar voorheen de vleugels werden gespreid om iets te ondernemen, ploffen zij nu neer met een biertje op de bank. Zoals Cruijff zei: “Elk nadeel heb zijn voordeel”. Het afgelopen jaar was er meer ruimte voor diepgang en zingeving. Er werden steeds langere en diepgaande gesprekken gevoerd. Veelal liepen deze gesprekken uit tot een discussie, waarbij de heren elkaar niet sparen. Je zou rustig kunnen zeggen dat de één na de ander het pispaaltje is. Allemaal met een korreltje zout en de rode draad is gebaseerd op een liefdevolle broederschap waarin satire en humor hoog in het vaandel staan.
 
Deze mannen zijn werkzaam in een andere tak van sport. Paul is audio engineer, Omid een consultant en Joël werkt in de GGZ. Totaal uiteenlopende beroepen. Wat hun samenbrengt is muziek. Uit verveling hebben zij een track opgenomen. Want; Hoe moeilijk kan het zijn op een knap liedje te produceren? En hoe moeilijk kan het zijn op een podcast op te nemen? Je zou kunnen zeggen dat zij geen uitdaging uit de weg gaan. Of het een succes is? Of je hier blij van wordt? Oordeel zelf….
 
De podcast
Elke aflevering worden er een aantal (mannelijke) onderwerpen besproken die centraal staan in het leven van deze heren. In gesprek proberen ze steun en antwoorden bij elkaar te vinden. De heren tappen alle drie uit  een ander vaatje, wat de belichting qua invalshoek gekleurd houdt.
 
Enjoy

title: Chatting with Creators
description:
Amid the COVID-19 pandemic, I sought out a way to create content that, like Coffee With Composers allows people to connect to musicians on a personal level. During this time, I thought we needed it more than usual. When members of the Glenn Korff School of Music reached out to me about creating videos to help keep our community connected, I thought this would be a perfect idea. Going beyond the Flyover New Music Series, in Chatting With Creators, I connect with various creatives from the music industry to talk to them about how they’re dealing with the pandemic, their advice for students, and most importantly, how we all stay connected even when we’re apart. 

I thought this would be a one-and-done series, but I've had so many requests to continue! I love making the series, so here's season two! For season one information, check out sapphiretoth.com

title: The Cobblestone Podcast
description:
The Cobblestone Podcast is a series of conversations with prominent figures from the rich musical community, based in the Cobblestone pub at the top of Smithfield square, Dublin.

Created by Tom Mulligan in 1988, the Cobblestone has played host to Traditional music sessions daily, for the last 30 years. Be it a session up the front or a concert in the Back Room venue, there is an inevitability of bumping into top-class musicians with a passion for their art. the Cobblestone has no TVs or pool tables and people are encouraged to sit back with a pint, have a conversation, or listen to some great music. 

Join hosts, Ispini na hEireann, who interview a plethora of Musicians and Characters that have made their way through the doors of the cobblestone at one time or another. We hope you enjoy this podcast and it brings you just a small bit closer to the comfort Cobblestone through the medium of conversation.

With thanks to Tom Mulligan for giving us this opportunity and Neillidh Mulligan for allowing us the use of his tune, Barr Na Cuille, as our theme. Thanks To Stephen McCann For his tireless work on sound.

find us @ http://cobblestonepub.ie/
                 Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ispini_na_heireann/
get in touch @ sausagesofireland@gmail.com

Hosts: Adam Holohan & Tomas Mulligan (Ispini Na hErieann)
Sound: Stephen McCann

title: Joost mag het weten
description:
Welkom bij de podcast 'Joost mag het weten'.  

De podcast waar je als luisteraar geen complete weergave krijgt, maar mag dwalen, om hier en daar een luikje open te maken; waarachter een versnipperd beeld wordt geschetst van het huidige afstudeer jaar te Sint Joost Breda, ART&RESEARCH 4 (2021). Het is juist die versnippering, die fragmentatie, die deze lichting typeert. 

Deze podcast legt de nadruk op de vertakkingen van het makerschap, haakt in elkaar waar nodig en deint mee op de golven van zij die al dobberend zoeken naar uitwisseling.

De structuur van de podcast is, net als de makers, aan verandering onderhevig. Er wordt gebruik gemaakt van bekende elementen maar is verder vrij in beweging, zo zijn er verschillende rubrieken, waarvan sommige terugkerend en andere eenmalig aanwezig.

It is inspirational, informative, and fun talks with other filmmakers about their projects and their journeys. Scranton Talks is part of the Independent Film Creative Hub. Based in Scranton, Pennsylvania, hosts Luz Cabrales and Desiree Zielinski founded the Independent Film Creative Hub which is geared to help filmmakers reach their potential in becoming successful creative artists!

title: Grindrod PR podcast
description: The Grindrod PR Podcast provides engaging storytelling about Independent music artists and life lessons from host Chris Grindrod. Hear storytelling that spans 30 years of a PR journey through different music genres and passionate appeals to keep moving forward and be seen and heard. Chris presents a very unique narrative.

title: The Bunker Files
description: Inspired loosely by the radio dramas of old, Nighthawk and Mestopheles saw the writing on the wall from the crazy year that 2020 was and decided to get a jump on living out the end of the world in style.

title: WHAT ABOUT US?
description: Everyone has a story to tell.. Whats yours?

title: Sewing for Drag Queens
description: As a designer / maker and lover of all things drag, I'm interested in the people behind the costume as much as I'm interested in the performers wearing it. In this podcast I want to explore and understand the process behind the end product by speaking to the people that MAKE.

title: who's you?

Each month, we interview a creative professional and get to the bones of what it looks like to create for a living.

Expect to find unreleased music and brand new tracks from a variety of dance music genres. Get ready and let your senses take control. One of a kind experience is waiting for you. Enjoy the ride.

We'll be having down to earth conversations with artists representing the jazz and poetry community, discussing the history of their art forms and why jazz, poetry and literacy is important to our culture.

This podcast complements our digital assistant software, providing insights from industry experts on how to start, run and grow a successful music teaching studio.

title: Macbeth: The Podcast
description:
Designed as an exciting and immersive learning tool for students, Macbeth is performed by our professional acting company in five action-packed episodes, complete with cinematic score and soundscape.   Read along with the text as you listen, get entangled in Shakespeare's bloody, murderous plot, and discover why Macbeth is still one of the greatest tragedies ever written. 

This activity is made possible by the voters of Minnesota through a grant from the Minnesota State Arts Board, thanks to a legislative appropriation from the arts and cultural heritage fund.

Directed by Doug Scholz-Carlson and Victoria Nassif | Text Coaching by Victoria Teague | Sound Design by Scott O’Brien | Sound Editing by Nathanael Brown

Featuring: Andrew Carlson (Macbeth) | Leah Gabriel (Lady Macbeth) | Michael Fitzpatrick (Duncan) | Will Sturdivant (Banquo, Siward) | Vanessa Morosco (Macduff) | Valerie Lynn Brett (Lady Macduff, Hecate) | Alex Campbell (Malcolm) | Chris Pow (Ross) | Brittany Proia (Lennox) | Melissa Maxwell (Seyton) | Victoria Nassif (1st Witch, 1st Murderer, Doctor) | Gavin Mueller (2nd Witch, 2nd Murderer) | Lauren Winder (3rd Witch, Gentlewoman) | Doug Scholz-Carlson (Captain, Caithness) | Jackson Mixon (Donalbain) | Liam Carlson (Fleance) | Emma Bucknam (Servant) | Lyda Carlson (Macduff Child) | Hannah Young (Young Siward).  Thanks to KQAL and WSU.

Score and soundscape originally designed for GRSF’s 2019 season production, directed by Paul Mason Barnes. Thanks to KQAL and WSU.

title: American Cycle
description: This is American Cycle, a podcast featuring Larry Beckett’s live performances of his poetry. Beckett’s poems have been collected in the book American Cycle, which Jonah Raskin says “takes readers into the past and rewrites our national epic for the twenty-first century.” Inspired by our folklore and past, American Cycle is available now from Running Wild Press.

title: Shake the Sword!
description:
Produced by the Tsikinya-Chaka Centre at the University of the Witwatersrand (South Africa). 

Shakespeare, transnationalism, multilingualism.

title: Performance Anxiety Podcast
description: Have you ever experienced anxiety while trying to create, perform, or even prep for your art? So have we! Join Lauren and Tabitha as they talk to different guests from all over the artistic world (theater, twitch, music, and more)about situations when they have experienced performance anxiety and what they have done to overcome it. Often funny, but always insightful, it helps turn a spotlight on something that can afflict many people, in many situations.

title: Verse Mentors
description: What stories can we tell about the people who make us into poets? Verse Mentors is a new four-part podcast series exploring the world of poetry and mentoring. Explore the often unsung web of support that gets our best words into the best places

description: Two life long friends who talk for a long time

title: First 8 Count
description: Origin stories of dance related friends

description: Two friends from New York, Hi-Cool DaPoet and Nic, giving their honest opinions on some of the current topics happening in the world and interviewing new artists of all genres (music, art, film, etc.) and entrepreneurs of all business aspects while having a few drinks. Tune In!!

title: Sound in Motion
description: A podcast at the intersection of filmmaking and film music. Hosted by percussionist and composer Peter Naughton.

description: The boys and I sit down and talk about what makes our favorite songs our favorite songs. You're sure to have a great time hearing it straight from the mouths of Ezra (8) and Otis (5-6).

description:
Words For The Deaf is a series of audio recordings spurring from personal short form narratives. The title of the series, "Words For The Deaf" comes from the idea that these narratives are most likely not going to be listened to.

I'd love to hear feedback and get to know my listeners, feel free to contact me anytime!
Contact Info: words4thedeaf@gmail.com

description:
From hard rock to heavy metal and AOR and westcoast music. In-depth discussions and special guests are always on tap so tune in and turn it up!

Your hosts Tom Coyne & Mark Balogh dive deep into each episode, whether it's with a guest or just breaking down a band or artists career in music to give you an insight into the music we all love. So come along for the ride!

description: Een podcast met korte verhalen door striptekenaar/illustrator Rob van Barneveld van Studio Rood Gras.

title: Through The Mic
description:
Born out of the Covid-19 isolation period, Through the Mic is a podcast that offers a platform for artists and creatives alike to share their work and discuss what it means to create...especially now. Hosted by young artists themselves, Malcolm and Will seek to push conversations about our work forward by passing the mic to the emerging and veteran voices of our worldwide community. 
keep the conversation going with us: themicpodcast1@gmail.com

title: The Milo Beasley Show
description:
Welcome to The Milo Beasley Show (but now in Podcast form!) 
After 7 years, and 300+ episodes on the youtubes, we are finally moving to the podcast medium. Yeah, its about time, we know. 

Check out hundreds of interviews with your favorite celebrities, professional wrestlers, bands, and more! We promise to throw some podcast-exclusive content this way as well. 

Thanks for listening. TELL YOUR FRIENDS!

title: KULTÚRA, ÖKOLÓGIA, BOTANIKA - KERT A KÖBÖN
description:
Kert a köbön - avagy a tudományos-kulturális szórakoztatás az ökológiai szemléletformálás oltárán.
Az Ökológiai Kutatóközpont egyedülálló projektje 2021 nyarán izgalmas estekkel, valamint egy háromnapos fesztivállal várta a látogatókat Vácrátóton, a Nemzeti Botanikus Kertben.
Az ország legjelentősebb ökológiával foglalkozó intézeteit tömörítő Ökológiai Kutatóközpont útjára indította a Kert a köbön eseménysorozatát, amely tényleg köbre emelte hazánk első számú botanikus kertjét: egymás mellé állította a kultúrát, az ökológiát és botanikát. 
A multidiszciplináris és multikulturális programsorozat fő célja volt olyan témák boncolgatása ‒ közérthetően és nyári könnyedséggel ‒, amelyek fontosak az ökológiai szemléletformálás szempontjából. A projekt hidat teremtett a tudományos és művészeti megközelítés között, hogy a valóság megértéséhez egy átfogóbb képet kapjon a társadalom.
A programsorozat beszélgetésekkel összekötött koncertélményekkel várta a közönséget. A borkóstolós, nyár esti társalgások sajátja volt, hogy különböző területről érkeztek szakemberek: többféle tudományterületről, a gyakorlati életből, a művészetből és a médiából egyaránt. 
A nyár végén háromnapos Kert a Köbön Fesztivállal zárult a különleges és hagyományteremtő kezdeményezés, amelynek középpontjában az ökológia, az irodalom és a zene állt. 
Mindez egy kétszáz éves történeti kertben, amely kiemelkedő természeti és kulturális gazdagságával fogadta be az eseményeket.

title: Talking The Groove
description:
Talking the Groove is an exploration of music, art and culture through conversations with those who create, produce, facilitate and experience art from the Global Leftfield.

Presented by Bob Hill of The Illicit Grooves Radio Show

title: Hume Conversations Podcast hosted by Garth Prentice with Mike Baker
description:
Welcome to the revamped Hume Conversations Podcast hosted by our Head of Contemporary Music - Garth Prentice.

Hume Conversations will be a casual series of entertaining chats with local and visiting musicians, Hume Con staff and students, and guests from across our region. Click on the link below to subscribe - and please send through your reviews and feedback, and suggestions for Garth to chat with.

title: Room Twelve31
description: Welcome to Room Twelve31 where we discuss any and everything from different careers, lifestyles to history and politics.  What this podcast you can expect no filters and no holding back, we want to have that behind close door conversations brought to you live and direct.

title: Exploring Creativity
description: Our goal is to inspire, educate and provide a community for creative people to do the best work of their entire lives.

title: Mister Melatonin
description: I've always found that reading a chapter before bed both eases the mind, and soothes the soul. So whether you need help sleeping, or you're just looking for the right book, the Mister Melatonin podcast is your one-stop-shop for all things audiobook. Ranging from character voices, to the soothing crackles of a fireplace. Join me on an adventure through fantastical literature, and perhaps you'll even get lost in your new favorite novel.

title: Next Brave Thing Podcast
description:
After working with hundreds of clients and going on my own personal emotional health journey I have discovered that breakthrough is on the other side of bravery. In this podcast I hope to inspire you to discover your small brave steps to get you the life you desire! Subscribe, download, share and write a review!

In this podcast Ella covers the following topics:

- What it means to live a courageous life
- Healthy risk vs destructive risk
- Navigating the tension of valuing feedback for growth but letting go of critics that keeps you small
- How bravery shows up in relationship dynamics
- Learn what it means to trust yourself and love yourself
- Shame free creativity

title: BUITEN HET BOEKJE
description: Podcast door Elien Van Aerschot waar ze de mens aan de andere kant van de microfoon beter leert kennen door diverse vragen te stellen binnen het boekje maar ook enkele vragen die niet in het boekje staan...

title: Smoke on the Water
description: Welcome to Ballmer hon!  Deep conversations with friends, new and old.

description: Despite recessions, a pandemic and natural disasters the Waco Civic Theatre has been proudly bringing quality live performances to Waco for almost 100 years. Join us in Costume Closet Chats as we discuss the trials, joys and the journey of running a nonprofit community theatre in the Heart of Texas.

description: OrcishWC and Beesneez discuss online Roleplay, real life, and the outstanding private roleplay server for Red Dead Redemption 2 called WildRP. Every week a guest is brought on. Enjoy segments like, "ask that question" and more.

description:
Hi! I am a local Chicagoan who interviews BIPOC (black, indigenous, and people of color) music groups far and local! :) Ever wondered what your favorite up-incoming punks are up to? Will you found a home! Tune in to learn about our movers and shakers of subculture! From punk to indie to rap to metal! Please rate and follow me on socials!

description: Join Shimire, as he speaks with many talented artists in different niches about their creative journeys and inspirations.

description:
The things on everyones minds that no one wants to say.

Join Manna and Derrick as they chat about their observations of our world. These are simply their opinions at the moment. Not right, not wrong, simply opinions. What's yours?

title: The Abyss radio show
description:
The Abyss is a weekly dance show hosted by Jon Hodgson and dedicated to the latest pre-releases, white-labels and emergent previews in electronic dance music - essentially a total promo-fest!

The show runs for two hours, mixed to the max and slowly descends from the light and bouncy to the dark and deep over the length of the show. We feature occasional guest mixes from both established and up-and-coming artists within the dance scene, with their set left completely up to the artist to showcase their talents, taste and skills.

The show broadcasts each week and can be heard from various syndicated sources gently sprinkled around the planet.

For full details please visit our FaceBook page @TheAbyssRadioShow

To contact the show :
Email: shows@theabyssradioshow.info
SMS: 07520 634 256
Web: https://theabyss.digital

title: BVB Army Hearts to Hearts
description: BVB Army Hearts to Hearts is Co-Hosted by Ruth Campbell and Niccole Perkins, designed by and for fans of the band Black Veil Brides. You know the band, now you can meet some of the fans. Some long and loyal, some new and eager for what is down the road. We get to explore that together here and have some fun along the way. Posted every Wed @ 1pm CST

title: Podcast Drama
description:
Podcast Drama este un podcast lansat de adolescenții din trupa de teatru Brightside Drama în care personajele principale suntem noi. Alegem subiecte care ne interesează, invităm oameni de la care vrem să aflăm lucruri noi, ne punem întrebări și râdem. Uneori prea mult, dar avem o scuză. Vârsta.

title: Dream Baby Dream
description: Welcome to the DREAM BABY DREAM podcast. My name is Taylah Clements, and I talk all things life, acting, creative industries, mental health and just how to get by. Total disclaimer: I am not an industry professional, far from successful right now, but I feel I have a lot to chat about.

title: Jednorožec mezi nosorožci
description:
• Ahoj, já jsem Leontýna. Vítám vás u podcastu „Jednorožec mezi nosorožci“. Skrze podcast bych vám ráda představila příběhy lidí a jejich profesí a životních vášní. Ráda bych jim tak dala možnost promluvit o sobě a o jejich tvorbě. Zároveň je tak trochu zviditelnit. Mně samotnou totiž velmi zajímá, co všechno se skrývá za jejich tvorbou. Proč dělají to co dělají? Co je k tomu dovedlo? Jak objevili to své "ono"? Co musí udělat než dojdou k finálnímu výsledku své práce? Jaké to je stát na vlastních nohách v této době? Jak jsou spokojeni po finanční stránce? A jaká mají svá tajná přání? Atd. Chtěla bych zvát ty, kteří jsou sami sobě šéfem, pracují na sebe a tvoří z lásky k dílu samému. Lidi z různých odvětví - divadelníci, výtvarníci, tanečníci, hudebníci, maséři, psychologové, cestovatelé, a další.   

  • Pokud znáte někoho, koho byste tady chtěli slyšet, anebo byste rádi přišli vy sami, neváhejte mě kontaktovat. Všechny informace jsou v popisu. Jinak budu moc ráda za jakékoliv sdílení a zpětné vazby.  Můžete se těšit každý týden na nový rozhovor.   Přeji příjemný poslech. 

  • Kontakt na mě: FB: https://www.facebook.com/tynka.janku/ , Ing: @jednorozecmezinosorozci

    Podpořte mě: 1618120017/3030 (do zprávy napište třeba „Jednorožec“)

    Zvuk: Miroslav Beran - mberan90@gmail.com

title: J Hirtle The Last Storyteller
description: Poet and storyteller J Hirtle began his writing career with the book "Going Numb", a story about addiction, and faith. Writing the book rekindled his life-long love of writing. Storytelling. His stories and poetry cover everything from faith, addiction, history and love...in other words...life.

title: Off Book With Brooke
description: The podcast for anyone interested in performing. Host Brooke Chamberlin, a young performer based in Cincinnati, Ohio, walks you through her journey of being a young performer. Educational, inspirational, and conversational, it’s always a fun time and you won’t want to miss it!!

title: WTMY! | Wise To Meet You!
description: Wise To Meet You! (WTMY!) gaat verder dan een 'Nice to meet you!'. We gaan verder dan het normale, beleefde praatje en het liefste praten we direct over wat relevant en belangrijk is. Wat mag best eens gezegd mag worden of naar gevraagd mag worden? Dat bespreken we graag. We willen weten wat de personen die we interviewen motiveert en hoe zij tot hun visie zijn gekomen. De gesprekken gaan in de kern over vrijheid en we nodigen je uit om samen met ons te luisteren naar elkaars ideeën hierover en er ook over in gesprek te gaan met je omgeving.

title: Queers in the Club
description: A new music podcast with an LGBTQ+ focus. Host George showcases new drops from queer artists, producers, DJs and songwriters, spanning a variety of pop, hip-hop, indie and alternative genres.

title: Q&A with E&A
description: Fun times with two girls who barely know each other :)

title: Гласът на нашите корени
description:
Гласът на нашите корени е подкаст канал, който представя по артистичен, приятен и интригуващ начин известни литературни текстове, голяма част от тях включени в задължителната учебна програма. Текстовете са преплетени с песни събирани по време на нашите етнографски експедиции с цел създаване на една пълнокръвна образност на съдържанието. За основа на всеки епизод използваме един от спектаклите на театрална лаборатория Алма Алтер. Текстовете ще се изпълняват от актьори от Алма Алтер под режисурата на Николай Георгиев. Всеки месец от годината очаквайте по един епизод: 
Януари - “Албена” по Йордан Йовков
Февруари - “Последна радост” по Йордан Йовков
Март - “Житие и страдания грешнаго Софрония” по автобиографичния разказ на българския духовник и будител Софроний Врачански
Април - “За бащата и за братята”, за живота и идеалите на братята Христо и Евлоги Георгиеви
Май - “Часът на моето убийство”, за живота и делото на  Стефан Стамболов  по романа на Христо Даскалов
Юни -  “Дядо Йоцо гледа” по Иван Вазов
Юли - “По-добре да бъдеш недоволен човек отколкото доволна свиня” по Алеко Константинов
Август - “Септември” по Гео Милев
Септември - “Що е отечество” по текстове на Гео Милев
Октомври -  “Гаврошовци и котета разбойници” по текстове за деца на Гео и Леда Милеви, 
Ноември -  “Маргарита и Майстора” по романа на Михаил Булгаков
Декември - “Мъртвият Дом” по едноимения роман на Ф. М. Достоевски Записки от мъртвия дом. 
Преди всеки епизод ще има и кратък разговор със създателите на епизода, които в един интерактивен диалог ще извеждат основните послания на текста и мостовете му с днешната действителност. Приятно слушане!
Дейностите по проекта "Гласът на нашите корени" отразяват единствено гледната точка на автора и Комисията не носи отговорност за използването, по какъвто и да било начин, на съдържащата се в тях информация.
Проектът се реализира с финансовата подкрепа на Европейски корпус за Солидарност към Европейски съюз

title: Comedy Babble w/ Trent Babb
description: Aspiring comedians, discover what you should NOT do in stand-up comedy.  Listen, learn, and laugh. New episode every Thursday.

title: Feferity Inspire
description: Feferity radio supports community and educational conversations that focus on issues important to the local and our international communities. We promote artists, musicians, writers and creatives. We facilitating conversations that helps voice out opinions and experiences to our wider audience.

title: Grow n' Flow
description:
Carly Scruggs talks all things normal developing adults struggle with. From the universal feeling of being alone to how medicine treats minorities. Including guests to talk about an array of topics that may impact listeners, or may help us have more compassion for people.
Growth happens when we push our boundaries. That journey is not linear and that's why we'll flow together, too!

Meie õpetajad ja tantsijad räägivad muidugi TANTSUST, teekonnast dotEs ja mujal, tantsumälestustest ning motivatsioonist.
Jagame mõtteterasid ja abinõusid tantsijalt tantsijale.

title: The State of Fem Art
description: Hosted by Timea Faulkner, The State of Fem Art podcast  is a space where we celebrate and amplify the voices of women artists and creative entrepreneurs taking a deep dive into the successes, barriers, and joys of what it means to be a woman navigating your creativity, personal life, and the industry. Here, women will tell their own stories, authentically, boldly, and unapologetically.  Each interview is a new journey, as we continue to curate spaces, conversations an resources for women artists + creatives to thrive!

title: Playin' Around With Playbook
description: From the online jazz education conservatory, Playbook Jazz, Sammy Miller interviews educators and performers on their life experiences and knowledge. Episodes are live from the @playbookjazz Instagram!

title: Heavy Smoke Podcast With Shiest Bubz

title: The Brass Ceiling
description:
Hi everyone! I’m Yael and welcome to The Brass Ceiling.

I am a trumpet player, but also a musician, and most importantly, a storyteller. I also happen to be a girl, and despite it being 2022, only 3% of trumpet players are female. Consequently, I have always had to navigate a male-dominated environment riddled with gender, age, and power dynamics… in other words I’ve dealt with a lot of crap and I’m sick of it!

The title of this podcast, The Brass Ceiling, is really just a play on the phrase "the glass ceiling"; this pun on the famous saying feels relevant as I want to bring to light the gendered struggle that female brass players experience which is preventing them from thriving in this niche, just as on a more macro level, women and most non-straight-cis-white-men have to navigate countless systems that were not built with them in mind.

I want to use this space to talk about our stories and our musical journeys, but I also want to use this platform to crowdsource and workshop ideas to make the arts more equitable. The goal is to find that sweet spot that is fun and nostalgic, but also rigorous and forward-facing. I’m hoping that by sharing our experiences, by engaging in dialogue about the systems that need changing, and by delving into music in a way that is accessible as well as palatable,  that we will in fact be shattering the Brass Ceiling, together.

title: The Ballad of 18 Women
description:
Women in Action was an arts and heritage project, led by Collective Encounters in 2020-2022, that used drama and creativity to celebrate women’s resilience, activism and community organising across Merseyside. The Ballad of 18 Women is the major final outcome of the project, incorporating testimonies recorded in oral history interviews as well as poetic narration and original music and song. 

This radio ballad highlights the stories of 18 Merseyside women to give an insight into the incredible contributions women make every day to improve lives in our region. Woven together, they give a glimpse of the multitude of positive actions that hold, nurture and empower our communities.

The 18 women share a concern for fairness and social justice, but their causes, actions and impacts are many and varied. Some would not consider themselves to be ‘activists’, but all have given of themselves to help others and in doing that have made the world a better place. The radio ballad pulls some common threads from their stories; the archive collection (available online or on request) offers the full recording for each person, showing the richness of their individual contributions.

We hope the ballad and recordings will inspire new women activists, as well as sustain, celebrate and encourage those who are already working for change: it is a homage to these 18 women and to you.

Written by Sarah Thornton
Composed by Bethany Kay Hopkins
Directed by Tessa Buddle
Sound Design by Karen Lauke
Artwork by Doriscakes Creates

Featuring the voices of: 
Alma Brown, Anna Reid, Anne Gorton, Anya Chapman, Chantelle Lunt, Clara Paillard, Doreen McNally, Felicity Dowling, Imogen Woolley, Johanna Schweier, June Hudson, Keith Barber, Libby Mackay, Lois Woolley, Lynda Cash, Maddy Vaz, Margaret Mariette, Mary O’Sullivan, Olivia Graham, Terri Heldt, Tracey Dunn, Zi Lan Liao

For more information about Women in Action visit: https://collective-encounters.org.uk/projects/women-in-action/

To explore the full interviews with the 18 women visit: https://audio.maydayrooms.org/the-ballad-of-18-women 

Made possible with funding from National Lottery Heritage Fund, PH Holt Foundation, LCVS, Arts Council England, and Liverpool City Council; archived in partnership with the Museum of Liverpool and MayDay Radio.

title: Skit Your Shorts: The Short Stories Sketch Comedy Podcast
description:
Skit Your Shorts is a short stories sketch comedy podcast hosted by comedy writer, Dutch Foley, and an evil-ish AI program named, Plot Bot 9000. Each week, Plot Bot challenges Dutch and his friends with the task of making him laugh with hilarious sketches and short stories. If they fail to launch his giggle code, (01101000 01100001) he promises to initiate the robot wars and destroy all humans. Can comedy save the world? Find out in the next episode!

While listening Skit Your Shorts, you may laugh, you may cry, or you may drive your car into a burning building. If the latter, ask yourself, "am I a moth? Why else would I drive straight into this shining ball of fire? Who gave a moth a driver's license?"

While you're busy contemplating your mortality, someone else should be calling the fire department. I bet the firefighters look just like in those calendars full of beefy hunks welcoming you into each month. Just kidding, they're probably all out of shape. Why else would the building still be on fire long enough for you to drive into it? Beefcakes would have been there in seconds. Firetruck? Forget it, musclefighters run to the scene and flex until the flames cower and dissipate.

Tune in weekly for the best comedy podcast that no one is listening to!

description: At nearly 17, Johnnie knows love: love for his family and for his biggest passion, playing the piano. But when alcohol is outlawed, making work harder on his police officer father, life in 1920s Atlantic City isn't as simple as it used to be. With the help of some friends, both new and old, Johnnie must find his place and his voice in the sometimes dangerous world of jazz and prohibition. "Johnnie's Song" was written by award-winning playwright DC Cathro and produced by ERALôR NFT. ERALôR is a registered business dedicated to creating nostalgic experiences, while promoting positive, human connection through vintage art, performance based storytelling, and immersive events and travel. To purchase a piece of character art from the "Johnnie's Song" series, visit https://eralor.io or follow us on twitter, @ERALORnft. Voice Over Cast: Johnnie .... Jacob Albert Gross Clara .... title: Sock Hop Saturday Night
description:
It's easier to say what the show ISN'T! This show ISN'T your typical, consultant-driven oldies show that only plays the same 300 songs over and over until you are sick of hearing them. It ISN'T robot-radio with a personality-less host and lots of liner cards. It ISN'T a show that tells listeners they can't request a song they want to hear instead of the consultants choice.

What it IS is a unique, weekly oldies radio program that caters to its base of dedicated fans and regular listeners. It's different every week with the ability to draw from a playlist of over 17,000 titles! Its host, Mark Edwards, brings life, personality and interaction to the show. It's fans are loyal followers with many listening from the opening intro to the close.

The mission statement could be summed up as: "At least once each broadcast, you'll roll your eyes back, place your hand on your forehead and say wow, I haven't heard this song in years!'
It began with uncertainty in 1994 but eventually turned into a ratings success story.  Mark Edwards brought his creativity, charm and music collection to the airwaves of Connecticut to bring listeners on a trip back in time.  So successful that it achieved the highest ratings of any show on the station’s lineup during its last Arbitron entry.  His unmistakable ability to give the audience what they wanted paved the way for success for over 28 years! The key to that success was, and still is, the diverse playlist. Thousands of songs from not only the “Hit Makers” of the time, but lesser known, but equally important groups.  Groups like The Academics, Accents, Admirations, Lee Andrews & The Hearts, Angels, Barons, Bell Notes, Blenders, Blossoms, Blue Notes, Bop Chords, Boss Tones, Cadets, Cadillacs, Calvanes, Cameos, Capris, Cardinals, Carnations, Cavaliers, Cellos, Earl Lewis & The Channels, Chaperones, Charms, Chimes, Chords, Cleftones, Clovers, Crests, Crows, Danleers, Darts, Defenders, Del Vikings, Dells, Demensions, Desires, Dominos, Dootones, Dreamlovers, Dubs, Duprees, Earls, Edsels, Emeralds, Eternals, Falcons, Fantastics, Fascinators, Five Keys, Five Royales, Five Satins, Flamingos, G-Clefs, Genies, Harptones, Heartbeats, Impalas, Inspirators, Jacks, Jaguars, Jewels, Jesters, Jive Bombers, Keytones, Bob Knight Four, Kodaks, Legends, Little Joe & The Thrillers, Love Notes, Frankie Lymon & The Teenagers, Lewis Lymon & The Teenchords, Magnificents, Marcels, Medallions, Mellows, Midnighters, Monarchs, Moonglows, J Neons, Nino & The Ebb Tides, Nobles, Nutmegs, Orchids, Orioles, Paragons, Paradons, Pearls, Penguins, Pentagons, Platters, Pyramids, Queens, Quin Tones, Ravens, Rays, Revlons, Rivieras, Rob Roys, Royal Jesters, Royal Teens, Scarlets, Schoolboys, Sensations, Shells, Shep & The Limelites, Sheppards, Solitaires, Spaniels, Starlites, Titans, Tokens, Top Notes, Treniers, Turbans, Universals, Uniques, Untouchables, Valentines, Valiants, Van Dykes, Velours, Videls, Videos, Vito & The Salutations, Wanderers, Wheels, Willows, LITERALLY TO NAME JUST A CHOSEN FEW!!!

ALL THAT IN ADDITION TO CHART TOPPERS LIKE ... Paul Anka, Frankie Avalon, Jesse Belvin, Chuck Berry, Gary US Bonds, Pat Boone, James Brown, Jerry Butler, Freddy Cannon, Ray Charles, Chubby Checker, Eddie Cochran, Sam Cooke, The Crystals, Danny & The Juniors, Bobby Darin, Dion, Fats Domino, The Dovells, The Drifters, Tommy Edwards, The Everly Brothers, The Fleetwoods, Connie Francis, Bill Haley & His Comets, Bobby Helms, Clarence "Frogman" Henry, Buddy Holly, Etta James, Jan & Dean, Brenda Lee, Bobby Lewis, Jerry Lee Lewis, Little Richard, Johnny Mathis, Ricky Nelson, Roy Orbison, Gene Pitney, Elvis Presley, Cliff Richard, The Ronettes, Bobby Rydell, Sam & Dave, Santo & Johnny, Jack Scott, Neil Sedaka, Del Shannon, Dee Dee Sharp, The Shirelles, The Skyliners, Jimmy Soul, Connie Stevens, Ed Townsend, Ritchie Valens, Bobby Vee, Bobby Vinton, The Ventures, Gene Vincent, Jackie Wilson, AGAIN, ONLY A FRACTION IN OUR COLLECTION.

title: 1 – Jeg taler dansk!
description: Velkommen til min podcast hvor jeg taler dansk. I lang historie kort… jeg er Australiens og besøgte Danmark i 2016 hvor jeg var ‘øjeblikkeligt’ i elskede med danskerne, dansksproget og Danmark! Jeg boede med min udvekslings familie og fundet mange venner! Det var det bedste år! Min tid var slut når 2016 var færdige fordi jeg manglere at flyve tilbage til australier. Dansk er svært at tale så min mål var til at finde dansk podcasts og YouTube kanel. Det var to problem… der var ikke så mange dansk folk i australier og min location giver mig ikke så meget dansk shows på Netflix og YouTube. Men jeg prøvede og prøvede at forsætte at snakker med min danske familie og danske venner og fundet mere og mere dansk podcast og selvfølegig snakke til min selv. Og til nylig jeg havde en ide! Jeg kunne starte min egen dansk YouTube kanel og dokument min rejse og være meget bedre til dansk og starte et dansk fællesskab! Så tusind tak hvis du har læse og ser min 1st episode og jeg vil gerne være ‘starte nogle ting særlig’

description:
Audiolibri e audio raccolte realizzate su richiesta degli autori o a seguito dei premi letterari "SEVEN" e "Project One", ideati e promossi dal Team CdA, in relazione al progetto culturale "IL PARLALIBRO" di Caffè delle Arti.

Voci: Michela Barone (attrice, doppiatrice e regista teatrale), Maury Incen (attore, doppiatore, scrittore, insegnante di recitazione), Mara Fronzi (attrice, per il cinema, la TV, il teatro, e doppiatrice), Angelo Blasetti (attore e doppiatore).

Registrazione, editing e montaggio sono a cura di Mauro Iannuccelli, tecnico del suono, musicista e compositore presso MultimediaPower Studio.

I testi sono stati concessi in uso a CdA per tutte le attività di promozione e divulgazione, in relazione ai premi citati o su esplicita Il parlalibro: richiesta degli autori.

Tutti i diritti restano di proprietà degli autori.

È vietata qualsiasi modifica, anche parziale, senza il loro esplicito consenso.
author_name: CdA Team di Caffè delle Arti

title: Aspiring Hollywood
description:
The "Aspiring Hollywood" idea developed while I was teaching screenwriting at UCLA Extension. I saw the need for a forum that provided advice to emerging filmmakers and artists from other entertainment industry sectors. I also wanted to offer a safe place for emerging artists where they could talk about their desires and ambitions and showcase projects. "Before the Glitz and Glamour."
​
Similarly, I wanted to give established industry professionals an opportunity to talk about their journey to success and offer advice to the new generation of filmmakers and artists across the board.

title: The Sounding Jewish Podcast
description: What does Jewish identity sound like, and why have scholars from around the world devoted their careers to studying it? The Sounding Jewish Podcast features host Dr. Samantha M. Cooper in conversation with global musicologists, ethnomusicologists and sound studies scholars who specialize in the music and sound of Jewish experience. Each episode highlights a guest’s area(s) of academic interest, preferred research methodologies, and decision to study music and sound. Our goal is to better understand what it means to be a twenty-first century Jewish music studies scholar.

title: Chicks Unhinged
New Trier Performing Arts Stories
description: For more than 100 years, the Performing Arts Department (PAD) at New Trier Township High School in Winnetka, Illinois has turned out scores of Hollywood and Broadway stars. From legends like Ann Margret, Ralph Bellamy, and Charlton Heston, to modern stars like Virginia Madsen, Adam Baldwin, and Rainn Wilson, the list of actors, writers, directors, producers, animators, set designers, costume designers, and more, is long. But why? What is it that makes New Trier so different? In this podcast, we will explore the answers to those questions by directly interviewing the graduates themselves. These are their stories.

title: TWO PASSING TIME

Join us on some of the hottest topics on the current and juiciest tea about our lives and people on Reddit. We cover relationships, dating, conflict, and Reddit stories.  The majority of our viewpoints are from an African point of view.  We are entitled to our opinions so we apologized in advance if you don't agree. 

We have so much to say and so little time!

The active participation of media continues to play a crucial role in the informational war against russian propaganda. It is our job to maintain the momentum by providing authentic stories with an international platform.

title: Luz de Faro
description: Escuchar programas de radio a la carta a través de internet está de moda. Y mola. Estás ante uno de ellos, ecléctico. Es decir, variado en contenidos sobre curiosos viajes, estremecedora memoria histórica, música con carisma, cine interesante de autor… Siempre, eso sí, capítulos que huyen de las prisas, interesantes y agradables de escuchar. La dirección y voz del periodista vasco Iban Gorriti te conducirá durante alrededor de una hora de duración a enclaves que buscarán acomodo en tu persona. Este licenciado en Ciencias de la Información escribe y dirige ‘Luz de faro’. Hoy en día, en un mundo tan universalizado, te invita a formar parte del engranaje de ese faro de mar ubicado en la ‘clandestinidad’ desde la que, además de arrojar luz cada siete segundos a modo de destello, te envía mensajes como aquellos de papel dentro de una botella. Ahora, Gorriti está esperando en primera persona a que los abras, que los compartas. “Que nos escuchemos con sosiego”, te invita el farero. Sintonízalo en tu diario de bitácora.

title: Чакащи артисти
description: Един подкаст посветен на изкуството, културата и необикновения човек. ЧовекътПлюс - Артистът. С водещ Кристина Беломорска. В епизодите заедно с вас ще се потапяме в извънредния свят на изкуството, разговаряйки с онези артисти, които са си поставили свръхзадачата да създават, променят и вдъхновяват културния контекст на страната, а понякога и отвъд пределите ѝ. С тях освен за творчество им и условията, в които го създават, ще разсъждаваме, доколкото можем, над големите въпроси. Тези въпроси, които замъчват душата и не ѝ остават мира, които я държат будна, търсеща и очакваща. Ще говорим за големите проблеми и големите мечти. Свободно и без цензура, каквото и да ни струва това, и честно ще разкриваме истината за това на какво се надява и какво чака един артист. Подкастът "Чакащи артисти" е и рубрика част от радиопредаването на Дарик радио "Игрите на ума", с водещ Иван Кацаров и продуцент Даниела Александрова. Проектът е подкрепен и от НФК, по програма "Творчески стипендии 2022 г." Това е общ проект на предаването „Игрите на ума“ и Кристина Беломорска.

description: Hi, this is a podcast about films. I will speak with writers, directors, actors, composers, cinematographers, and just about anyone else connected to films and filmmaking. Oh and TV shows. I love music too, so I will definitely talk to some musicians. Um, I'll talk to chefs and cooks about food too. I might talk to some authors. Politics? Most likely! I know that podcast logic is that you should only talk about one thing, but I probably won't. Maybe Burnt Orange Dreams is just about the things that I am passionate about. Yeah, that sounds about right.

title: Non Dimenticarlo
description:
NON DIMENTICARLO  di e con Arianna Brandolini e Paul R Cuddle - 
tratto dall’omonimo romanzo di Luca Contato - Musiche di Paul R Cuddle, testi di Arianna Brandolini e Luca Contato.  Questa sera vi vogliamo raccontare una storia, una storia che è contenuta tra le pagine di questo libro . Badate bene, non vogliamo raccontarvi il libro. Quello, chi vorrà, potrà leggerlo. Piuttosto vogliamo raccontarvi un punto di vista diverso. Il punto di vista di una protagonista silenziosa, troppo silenziosa. Cristina. 
Perché silenziosa dite? Ogni cosa a suo tempo. 
Per raccontarvi le sensazioni, le emozioni dei nostri protagonisti, abbiamo pensato che le sole parole della Vita non sarebbero bastate e ci siamo affidati al Tempo della musica: il tempo necessario alle emozioni per poter scorrere dal cuore alla mente.

Buon ascolto

title: Lex, Write About It.
description:
Hey, I’m Lex J; host of Lex, Write About It and I want to introduce you to my podcast! I started this podcast because of my vision to create a platform to expand and promote my spoken word book Lex, Write About It: Pain, Love, Me . 

The idea for my book came about because I wanted to fully depict my life and how my brain works. Often times things happen to us, whether that be good or bad, and we don’t always know how to relay our true emotions through words; so for me, I write. Writing helps me discover more and more about myself and my hope is that it’ll do the same for those listening.

title: Never Too Late
description: Wether they be songs, stories or conversations, they allow me to connect deeper to myself. And in sharing these connections, the hope is that they allow you to connect deeper too yourselves, and begin sharing yourself through conversations of your own. It is my contention that we’re all fighting the same fight inside of ourselves, yet fearful to show it. Yet vulnerability is contagious, and the only thing I can do better than anyone else is to be myself. And it’s Never Too Late to do that.

title: Coin Toss Converstions
description:
Introducing… COIN TOSS CONVERSATIONS We are thrilled to announce our new podcast - a space for chatting about the methods, magic and madness behind making theatre with a range of emerging and established companies and creatives. This first series of our ‘conversations’ aims to answer the question of how we create theatre in response to the climate emergency. This series was inspired by our own chats with each other as we rework FREAK OUT! - our show about how coastal communities are affected by climate change - for VAULT 2023, and we wanted to open up conversations with other really cool companies and shows tackling similar themes. We hope you enjoy!

This production is supported using public funding by the National Lottery through Arts Council England

FREAK OUT! - Vault Festival tickets: https://vaultfestival.com/events/freak-out/

Coin Toss Collective GoFundMe: https://www.gofundme.com/f/freak-out-at-vault-festival?utm_source=widget&utm_medium=referral&utm_campaign=p_cp+share-sheet

title: THE Masquerading Podcast
description:
Masquerading is THE Social Fiction Community.

You could be into LARP, Anime, you could be a lookalike, you could be a huge Doctor Who fan, be a Trekkie or even an avid Star Wars fan…. Either way, this podcast could be just what you're looking for.

Masquerading.com allows you to BE WHO YOU WANT TO BE… in costume, in character and following events.

Where else can you say that you are going to 'Obliterator a planet', or 'take somebody out', yes guys, you can be totally in character on Masquerading.com

So to start, I will be interviewing people who are already Masquerading on Masquerading.com!

I'll be finding out what made them start cosplaying, what inspires them, how they make their own costumes, how do they get into character, and more importantly, how do they stay in character!

title: Solo Cose Belle
description:
Musica, musica, musica e ancora musica. Se fondi la passione per qualunque genere musicale al piacere e alla voglia di comunicare qualunque cosa alla gente, allora devi metterti dietro un microfono e sarà magia.
Questa magia, Claudio l’ha scoperta nel 1988 e non riesce proprio a farne a meno.

Agli ascoltatori di Rsc- Radio Studio Centrale, offre Solo Cose Belle, dalle 12:00 alle 14:00, da Lunedì a Venerdì, ma state in campana perchè arriveranno Solo Cose Belle, anche quando meno ve l’aspettate.

Gli History Hit, le canzoni del passato, proposte da Solo Cose Belle, sono sempre delle chicche per veri intenditori.

E non dimenticate di scaldare le corde vocali, perché ogni giorno con ‘Canta che ti passa’, chiunque può cantare e dimostrare le proprie doti canore.

A MURDER OF MUSICIANS

A.M.O.M. Podcast

This podcast aims to showcase and promote the work of up- and-coming musicians and artists from diverse musical genres all around the globe.

Join host Fx2, each week as he explores various platforms on social media along with music distribution sites to discover amazingly talented players involved in the game of independent publishing. Every conversation reveals the simple ways each artist used to grow followers organically without monetary backing from a record label.

During the last 2 and a half decades, Fx2 has seen what was previously considered "indie," slowly morph into semi-mainstream practices of marketing, promotion and media/press. He also has witnessed the reverse, noting that grass rooted campaigns once considered taboo for signed musicians to lose the attached stigma as more superstar talent utilized methods of what can only be called "Organic-Ish."

The podcast gives you an opportunity to hear how different musicians navigate their specific path as an independent artist. As social media platforms compete for ways to dominate one another, musicians are seeing the immense benefits of cooperation and collaboration instead.

For those who don't know where is Azerbaijan, Azerbaijan is right between Russia and Iran, which is a very two-girls one-cup situation. I am a stand-up comedian from Berlin, Germany, and my style of comedy is realistic, dark & insulting. And this is exactly what I am planning to do on this podcast. Discuss everyday life situations, art, movies, contests, and roast them.

I think we need to get acquainted a little bit better. I was born as a very chubby kid, my mother did not know whether she delivered a baby, or a planet. My chemistry teacher put my name in a periodic table of elements under the heavy metal group. I was the only kid ay my school who played Saturn without the ring, as it just did not fit! I left Azerbaijan when I was 16, because my father said that the economy of Azerbaijan was not strong to feed me any more...

Interested in finding out more? Then come and join my Universe of Roast.

As sessões decorrem presencialmente, sendo mais tarde divulgadas através de um podcast.
A natureza informal que o próprio título da iniciativa deixa entrever não exclui a existência de um modelo, ainda que bastante flexível, de organização das sessões presenciais: o tema é introduzido por um orador convidado;, que de seguida dialogará com um interlocutor também convidado; antes de terminar, o debate será alargado ao público assistente.
O conteúdo audio será posteriormente editado com vista a melhorar a qualidade sonora do registo, centrando-se nos dois primeiros momentos das sessões presenciais. O podcast pretende guardar memória do que aconteceu e tornar a iniciativa acessível a um público mais vasto.

title: The Piano Pod
description:
...where tradition meets innovation, and together, we bring PIANO into the 21st Century.

Hey, 🎹 enthusiasts out there! My name is Yukimi, a classical pianist and educator from NYC and executive producer of The Piano Pod. The Piano Pod🎙 is a one-of-a-kind podcast that delves deep into the fascinating world of classical music, with a specific focus on the 🎹 piano. In a biweekly format, the show explores intriguing discussions with guests breaking exciting new ground in the classical music industry. The Piano Pod aims to nurture a thriving community that embraces innovative approaches to ensure classical music's relevance and vitality in today's dynamic landscape.

"How can I present the beautiful tradition of classical music to the 21st-century audience in a fun, contemporary, and engaging way?"

When I started building a piano studio in the trendy neighborhood of Downtown Manhattan in 2007 while in the NYU graduate program in piano studies, I began to ponder this question. I realized the stark difference in expectations toward classical music and music education between music professionals and the general public. Then, one of the NYU music department's professors suggested I start a podcast: the platform would allow classical musicians to address this disparity and spark conversations about audience engagement.

Finally, fast forward to 10+ years later, The Piano Pod was born in the summer of 2020. Since then, I have had the privilege of interviewing A-listers in the classical music industry: international concert pianists, composers, arrangers, digital streamers/influencers, music educators, entrepreneurs, neurodiverse specialists, and performance psychologists.

Through fascinating conversations, we have explored how classical music should continue to evolve to remain relevant to our lifestyle, society, and culture. Over the past three seasons, The Piano Pod has achieved remarkable success by reaching faithful listeners on audio platforms and viewers via YouTube.

As the show is celebrating the past season's achievements and gearing toward the new season in the fall, my mission as the Executive Producer is crystal clear: to provide a platform for classical musicians and educators to reflect and discuss ways to keep our industry robust and meaningful in this ever-changing world and move it forward in the post-pandemic era.

🔗Follow TPP on social media accounts to get the latest news about 🎹.

Thanks for listening♥️🎹

title: By Way of the Sea: A Regency Era Audio Drama
description:
The year is 1814, and Elena's life is about to change forever.

When Elena learns from her father that her past has been a lie, her entire life is uprooted all in one night. Along with a trunk of her mother's belongings, she is dropped off the next day at the pier to begin a voyage to her new home and her arranged marriage. While aboard the ship, she befriends Captain Jeremiah and his wife, Lucia, all while avoiding the condescending eyes of the first mate, Silas.

One night, after their ship runs aground in a storm, Silas is left to watch over Lucia and Elena on a tropical island, while the Captain goes to find help. Soon after, Kwesi and Bahia wash ashore, creating a new dynamic among the stranding souls, forcing Elena to determine what she wants for her life, and what she truly considers home.

A regency era story, with layers of humor, adventure, love, and self-discovery. A great episodic-series for fans of historical fiction, Jane Austen, Bridgerton, and other 19th century dramas.

By Way of the Sea is an original, immersive audio drama created by EraLore Studios, in collaboration with Stay Bizze. With voice acting by Brenna Patzer, Seth Rosenke, Karina Hilleard, John R. Smith Jnr, Enzo Leone, and Gervais Weekes.

title: Inside Imago

Hosted by Jimmy Blais, this is the inside-listen about Imago Theatre's upcoming productions, its artists, and the feminist themes they address.

Our work is committed to pushing boundaries, expanding form, and engaging in essential dialogue about urgent social issues. We centre feminist values, perspectives, and artistic practices within diverse stories, voices, and experiences.

We at Imago Theatre are privileged and grateful to live and work on unceded First Nation lands as uninvited guests of the Kanien'kehá:ka, Huron-Wendat, Abenaki, and Anishinaabe. We are committed to connecting and working with First Nation and Indigenous artists and arts workers to make space for their stories in order to create a greater understanding of what living here now really means.

description:
A 1950's Fiction based on facts story.

Follow the backstory and timeline of three main characters from the musical dramedy; Radio Girl and how they converge to create the Sputnik Satellite Radio Show on KNIC 1150 Radio in 1957. Nick Nickolas is the unabashed bygone era big band singer turned radio DJ and station Manager of KNIC 1150 Radio. He is a redeemed anti-hero who struggles his whole life just to win. Darrell Lang designs and builds KNIC 1150 Radio. He is a wounded WW1 veteran and former addict who becomes a multi-millionaire with his patented radio components and transistors. Tracy Albright suffers a head injury at a young age and struggles as a neurodivergent. She is a prodigy of radio wizard Darrell and is the young creator of the Sputnik Satellite Radio Show. Radio Girl becomes a national celebrity.
author_name: Blair Hebert,  Showrunner . Sputnik Satellite Radio Show .

title: Al Dès Matt

Benvenuti al podcast "Al Dès Matt".

In questo podcast, vi porteremo in un viaggio attraverso la bellezza e la ricchezza della lingua piacentina, attraverso la poesia.

Attraverso la narrazione di poesie locali di tempi passati, vogliamo celebrare l'importanza dei dialetti locali e della narrativa locale.

Siamo convinti che le lingue locali siano una parte essenziale della nostra cultura e della nostra identità

Sono la testimonianza del nostro passato, della nostra storia e delle nostre tradizioni. Attraverso la poesia, possiamo apprezzare la bellezza e la profondità di queste lingue. Il nostro podcast si rivolge a tutti ma soprattutto ai giovani che vogliono riscoprire le poesie locali dei loro nonni e bisnonni. Speriamo che le nostre narrazioni vi ispirino e vi portino in un viaggio nella cultura e nella tradizione della nostra terra.

Grazie per averci scelto e buon ascolto.

title: SANS FOR DANS
description:
Fra dans på scenen, på film og til anmeldelsen. Hvordan kan krop og dans røre os og vække følelser i os? Og hvad skal vi overhovedet bruge det til?

Dansk Danseteater udkommer nu med en række bevægende samtaler med danseeksperter fra vidt forskellige perspektiver på dans. I studiet har vi alt lige fra anmelderen til den kunstneriske leder og danserne selv i et princippet umuligt forsøg på at italesætte et sprogløst sprog – nemlig dansens væsen.

Vi taler om emner, der er relevante for dig, som er nysgerrig på at opleve danseforestillinger, men måske ikke helt har knækket koden til, hvorfor og hvordan du bedst skal gå til det. Og er du danse-aficionado, får du mulighed for at komme ind i maskinrummet og tankerne bag både det at arbejde med dans og forskellige kunstneriske processer omkring dansen. Værter bag mikrofonerne er prøveleder for Dansk Danseteater, Patricia Seron Pawlik, og teatrets projektudvikler, Anne Sophie Gertz.

Nogle episoder vil være på engelsk, mens andre er på dansk, alt afhængigt af, hvem vi taler med. Det vil fremgå af hvert enkelt afsnit. Vi håber, I vil tage godt i mod. Rigtig hjerteligt velkommen til ’SANS FOR DANS’.

Denne podcast er producereret af Dansk Danseteater.

Grafik: Søren Meisner

ENGLISH:

Dance on stage, on screen and in the review. How can the body and dance move us and arouse emotions in us? And why should we use it at all?

Danish Dance Theater is now releasing a series of moving conversations with dance experts from different perspectives on dance. In the studio, we have everyone from the critic, to the Artistic Director and the dancers themselves - in a basically impossible attempt to articulate a language without language - the essence of dance.

We talk about topics that are relevant to those of you who are curious about experiencing dance performances, but perhaps haven't quite cracked the code on why and how best to go about it. And if you are a dance aficionado, you will have the opportunity to get into the engine room and the thoughts behind both working with dance and various artistic processes around dance.

The hosts behind the microphones are rehearsal director of Danish Dance Theater, Patricia Seron Pawlik, and the companie's project developer, Anne Sophie Gertz.

Some episodes will be in English and others in Danish, depending on who we are talking to. This will be indicated in each episode. We hope you will enjoy the show. A very warm welcome to 'Sans for Dans'.

This podcast is produced by Danish Dance Theater.

Icon image: Søren Meisner

title: Dansen met de Dood
description:
Stap binnen in een wereld die je diep raakt... Een podcast die je meesleept op een enerverende reis, waarin de grenzen van leven en dood vervagen. Maak kennis met "Dansen met de Dood", dé podcast die afscheid nemen, herinneren en rouwen opnieuw definieert. Ik ben Aisha Krako-Bransen, jouw gids op dit bijzondere avontuur.

In deze buitengewone podcast onthullen we de vele geheimen van het leven en de dood. We graven diep in de betekenis van afscheid nemen, delen verhalen die je hart raken en bieden praktische inzichten die je wereld zullen veranderen. Bereid je voor om emotioneel geraakt te worden en kostbare herinneringen te ontdekken tijdens deze reis.

"Dansen met de Dood" is er voor jou, ongeacht of je een professional bent in de uitvaartindustrie, persoonlijk verlies hebt ervaren of simpelweg nieuwsgierig bent naar de menselijke ervaring rondom afscheid nemen. Deze podcast biedt diepgaande gesprekken en eert de geliefden die we zijn verloren.

Kom naar de dansvloer van "Dansen met de Dood", de podcast die de taboes doorbreekt en het leven omarmt, zelfs wanneer de schaduw van de dood dichterbij komt. Ben jij klaar voor deze intrigerende dans? Abonneer je nu en ontdek welke verborgen schatten deze podcast voor jou in petto heeft. Laat je betoveren en abonneer je vandaag nog!

title: coffeewithjah
description:
Welcome to coffeewithjah! A Christian-mixed poetry podcast, a space where poetry + creativity is espresso.

I am your host, jah! I'm so excited to share what the Lord has been brewing within me creatively. This podcast is an altar for the Kingdom of God, to bring unbelievers to the knowledge of Christ, and for believers to continue their pursuit of God in this creative space. Overall, I hope to encourage everyone to use their gifts to glorify God. As I share my journey in faith through this art, I pray you are inspired.

Please tune in every Wednesday at 11 a.m. Eastern time for a new cup of jahva.

I look forward to serving you!

Signing Off

title: PSST... Poetry, Songwriting, Storytelling,Theatre with Ri Baroche
description:
Psst....have you heard about ‘PSST...’? It’s a podcast series showcasing and celebrating queer voices in conversation with writer and performer Ri Baroche, produced by ArtfulScribe.

Four of Ri's favourite queer writers working in the SW regions to sit down and talk about all things queer and all things joy. The four writers are Jayne Ede (poetry), Beck Lombardi of Hunting Hearts (songwriting), Thorn (storytelling), and CJ Turner-Macmullan (theatre).

These artists talk about their approaches to writing, what it means to write as a queer person and how this contributes to their work, their advice to young queer writers, and how joy shines on the page. While we cover some of the essential topics of the difficulties continually faced by queer folx in UK society, this is very much a celebration of queer people coming together to talk in joyfulness about writing and queer stories.

Episodes are released every Wednesday in June 2023 to celebrate Pride Month. This series is supported by Arts Council England.

title: A Voice In Violet
description:
Synopsis:

Violet, a damaged singer whose dreams were shattered, headlines at The Driftwood, an infamous Hollywood club. The comfort of that stage is not enough when her traumatic past comes to visit. Bash, her manipulative former music manager, and his pop star girlfriend, Charlotte, destroy Violet's career. With everything taken away from Violet, all she has left is to seek revenge. Things get more complicated for Violet when Wang, the love of her life who broke her heart and sense of trust, visits her at the club. This bittersweet symphony is also composed of Salim, Violet's protector, and Lopez, an unhinged stalker. What will happen of Violet, those who stand in her way... and the voices in her head?

Tagline:

There is always an Encore…

A Voice In Violet is brought to us by Philly Chick Pictures, Writer and Director Curt Wiser (Cam-Girl), Executive Producer Brooke Lewis Bellas (iMurders), Producers Brooke Lewis Bellas and Curt Wiser, and Produced By Brooke Lewis Bellas. This talented podcast production team also includes, Casting Director Alison B. Buck (Pig), Composer Michael Trapp (Groupies), Music and Singer-Songwriter Fawn (Billboard Hit Recording Artist), Post Audio Engineer and Post Audio Mixing & Mastering Alex Hope (GoldenEye: Rogue Agent), Graphic Designer Jonathan Olaes (A Voice In Violet), Editor Curt Wiser, and Sound Effects and Sound Design Curt Wiser.

A Voice In Violet stars Film, TV, and Broadway veterans Brooke Lewis Bellas (Sinatra Club), Bronson Pinchot (True Romance; Emmy Nominee), Nikki Blonsky (Hairspray; Golden Globes Nominee), Eric Etebari (The Lincoln Lawyer), Nelson Lee (Mulan), and Wilson Jermaine Heredia (RENT; Tony Winner).

"Our A Voice In Violet Audio Drama Thriller Podcast has been an unbelievable education for me in the narrative podcast world in Hollywood. Like many creatives, I was navigating the virtual and audio space during the pandemic. I had been in-talks with my Talent Managers at Bohemia Group to develop a full Audio Drama Series and have Philly Chick Pictures and I produce a project, while still quarantining, to keep me creatively inspired. I greatly appreciated Curt’s writing talents and was impressed with his expertise in Sound Effects. Curt had pitched me a few fantastic storyline ideas, I fell in love with A Voice In Violet, and we began our production development process in the fall of 2021. We spent ample time fleshing out this series and assembling the necessary components. I was blessed to have Casting Director, Alison Buck, sign-on to help me cast our talented Actors (I had dreamed of!) Bronson Pinchot, Nikki Blonsky, and Nelson Lee (Thank you, Kat Seigworth!), then I had to have my talented friends and associates, Eric Etebari and Wilson Jermaine Heredia, onboard, as their roles were written for them, along with songs from my darling Diva Songstress Fawn, and score from the wild musical mind of Composer Michael Trapp. We truly assembled a dream cast, as well as keeping our commitment to diverse and inclusive character development and casting. As an Actress, I loved playing Violet so very much. Curt wrote this role perfectly for me and I had so much fulfillment finding the layers of this character throughout the audio series. I only hope the narrative audio podcast fans and listeners are entertained by A Voice In Violet." - Brooke Lewis Bellas

"It has been a thrill creating in the audio space, and with our talented cast who truly elevated the words off the page. Many thanks to Brooke Lewis Bellas for bringing this project together." - Curt Wiser

A Voice In Violet releases on multiple podcast platforms in 2023. Listen now with your free VIP pass to The Driftwood and a Champagne Toast!

Prej aktorëve, librarëve, botuesve, shkrimtarëve, kamarierëve, grave shtatzëna, aktivistëve…. të gjithë e kemi një lidhje morbide me librin. Voici des mots écrits il y a fort longtemps ou peu de temps. Par des hommes, par des femmes. Des mots écrits pour être dits, pour être entendus, pour être vécus. Des mots doux, des mots forts. Des mots qu'on a envie de prononcer juste du bout des lèvres.

title: Antediluvian Revelations: A Poetic Retelling of the Book of Enoch, The Prophet, Season Two
description:
This second season of the podcast series is the continued presentation of Antediluvian Revelations: A Poetic Retelling of the Book of Enoch, the Prophet, PART TWO. As explained in the introduction episode of the first podcast series by the same name and author, there are five parts of the epic poem. The first part of the epic poem presents the ancient testimony of Enoch who describes his extraterrestrial abduction experience and the reason for it to have occurred two generations before the birth of Noah. Enoch was the seventh man from Adam, and he was Almighty God's first prophet.

Season Two of this podcast series will cover the parables of Enoch, which are Enoch's presentation of additional, prophetic messages to future generations that might endeavor to read and understand his book. Because the original Book of Enoch may have actually been memorized in poetic format and spoken aloud from one generation to the next, this poetic retelling is being presented in oral fashion by reading it aloud.

Listeners can listen to the second season of this series for free with advertising on all the usual platforms, but early release and advertising free listening are available on Apple Podcasts. The entire production will be available as an audiobook or PDF with an estimated release date in December 2023.

Please visit our Associated Author's website!

title: How To Make Money As A Dancer Or A Choreographer | Manik bhatheja
description: If you are a dancer, this video is for you. I want to share the different types of dancers found in the Indian subcontinent. First type of dancers are those who prefer to go solo. They are like Rajinikanth, excellent at what they do and want to create their own solo brand. These are solo dancers. Then we have duet dancers who create this form of talent shared by two. They create a dance form, a style, and eventually build their brand. The third type are group dancers, where one person becomes the leader. They all follow this leader's vision. There is such coordination among them that it seems like an army. The fourth type of dancers are like potatoes, because they can do anything. They'll perform classical, Indian, Bangla, jazz, they will do it all. Check out all of our options for earning money as a dancer, including creating your own brand, hosting workshops, teaching classes, doing ad shoots, and more. Get creative and make some money with your moves! Options for earning money through dance - if you have that passion, a special talent, or a unique style, why not brand it? You could host your own workshops, teach classes, or even do ad shoots. If you're part of a dance crew, you could brand that too. Maybe through a reality show, a competition, or by creating interesting content for platforms like YouTube or Facebook. If you're a dancer currently working and learning in a dance company, you could align yourself with the company's vision, whether that's teaching, doing events, government shows, or anything else really. Here are three main types: teachers, small-scale choreographers, and senior choreographers. No matter your age, these professionals can help you take your dance skills to the next level. How many types of choreographers are there? First off, we have teachers. These are the ones skilled in making a non-dancer dance. It doesn't matter if they're kids, teenagers, or adults. The second type of choreographers is the cross between small-scale choreographers and assistant choreographers. They may lack experience, but they make up for it with their creativity and childlike sense of wonder. They are fueled by their curiosity, always willing to learn and do more. The third type is the army of experienced choreographers, including the senior choreographers or lead choreographers. These are the ones whose names are known far and wide, recognized for their unique concepts. Then, we've got the directors of choreography, the folks behind the camera. They work in ad shoots, movies, music videos, and massive musicals. Finally, we have system creators, who create a dance education system or program that countless people sign up to learn from. The video is for all the people who are from the Dance, Music or Entertainment background to help them gain knowledge of their respective professions while focusing on the - choosing options if you're a dancer in your Teens, 20's or 30's - visualising the demands of ever evolving entertainment industry and creating solutions to serve those demands - having a winner's mindset by being surrounded by the winners - formal training for a dancer - all about musicality - earning money as a dancer in india - becoming an entrepreneur in entertainment industry - how a dancer should manage money for future - how to sell your services and negotiate with clients willing to take your services - how to deal with copy cats who copy your ideas in much lesser price and compromise the market prices - how to establish a brand and stand out - the most important things a dancer, performer and artist should experience in life * Don't oblige anyone, the entertainment industry is mean and so should you be
