Some amazing revelations have been made known in this podcast series: Enoch was the first human to have been abducted by extraterrestrials. Noah, Enoch's great grandson, was the second human to have been abducted by extraterrestrials. Referring to the Chosen One (Jesus Christ) as "son of woman" is a blasphemy of Almighty God, which condemns the theology of Catholicism because it claims Jesus Christ was the son of God (son of woman), and many other shocking truths about the Eternal Truth that have been concealed from mankind for the last 2,000 years.

This final season still has plenty Antediluvian Revelations to present, so get ready for the apocalypse! Remember, this story has not ended because the apocalypse has not yet happened.

Production on this series will finish approximately mid-September, so be sure to subscribe or follow for notifications about new releases.

Thank you for listening!

I am Michael.

title: isletunes
description:
Prince Edward Island might be Canada's smallest province, but it has a surprisingly robust music scene. But there's never been a place to listen to all that scene has to offer in one place. Until now. "isletunes" brings the entire kaleidoscope of Island music into one podcast - from rock to pop to punk to rap, soul, and so much more, It's all genres, all decades, all-inclusive, and all PEI. Plus, alongside the province's traditional fiddle music, there are Black, Francophone, LGBTQ, and Mi'kmaq tracks to feast your ears on. While you're taking this radio-style podcast in, host Adam-Michael James also hips you to Island history and a healthy cross section of upcoming live gigs. There's never been anything like it on PEI before...it's the podcast PEI didn't know it needed!

Find where-to-buy links on isletunes.ca, and follow the podcast on Facebook at facebook.com/isletunes.

title: My Time, My Life
description:
Trinette Faint is a writer, model, actress, and creative entrepreneur. She is the author of Collette's Caleb and MidCoast Star, and has written for Vogue Knitting and Suitcase magazines, and the Google Cloud blog. She's also a Vogue Knitting cover model. Trinette is Harper's Bazaar's first Fabulous At Every Age grand prize winner, and has been featured in Marie Claire, Glamour, and on the Today Show, among other outlets. She's also worked in the entertainment business, notably as the personal assistant to Matt Damon, and is working on her first screenplay.

On My Time, My Life, Trinette discusses key, transformative moments in her nonlinear creative journey, and how she's had to define her own success, usually in the face of failure. My Time, My Life offers an unflinching look at the real sacrifices and struggles behind chasing her dreams, in the quest for commercial success. In sharing her experiences, she hopes to empower and inspire her listeners to keep chasing their dreams and to never give up.

Trinette believes that success rarely shows up in the way we think it should, especially when we define it by society’s standards. But when we define it ourselves, we are far more successful than we think.

Read the corresponding essays at Medium.com.

Visit Trinette at trinettefaint.com and follow her on instagram at trinette.faint.

My Time, My Life is a Floor 51 Production

title: Actor Essentials: Headshots & Self-Tapes That Shine
description:
Want to light up casting director's inboxes and land more roles? Your headshot and self-tape are the most vital tools in your actor's toolkit. Join hosts Angelica Novak and special guest Thomas Philipp, a talent agent from Dry Blue Agency London, as they dive deep on nailing these essentials for acting success.

Discover what makes for a winning, work-getting headshot—from finding the ideal photographer to styling, posing, and avoiding common mistakes. Thomas shares insider tips on headshots that pop, like pursuing naturalism, matching your vibe to your brand, and keeping the focus on your eyes. Learn the art of showing your strengths while still remaining flexible and castable.

Master the self-tape process from start to finish—from choosing readers and scripts to camera angles, lighting, and more. Hear Thomas' advice on dealing with technical glitches, using accidents to your advantage, and always staying in character. Plus, how to edit for impact while preserving authenticity.

With decades of experience and A-list clients, Thomas packs this episode with knowledge to upgrade your headshots, self-tapes, and booking potential. Discover the photographer traits to prioritize, retouching dos and don'ts, and quick fixes when ideal conditions aren't possible.

Whether you're just starting your acting journey or are already working but need refreshed headshots, this episode shares foolproof strategies to get noticed and get hired. Tune in now to craft your standout headshots and unforgettable self-tapes!

title: Bachata PopiWa Podcast
description:
Step into the enchanting universe of Bachata with PopiWa Podcasts, your premier portal to the vibrant rhythms of a global movement. As we venture into the pulsating heart of this phenomenon, we amplify voices from every corner of the Bachata realm: the maestros crafting hypnotic melodies, the dancers weaving stories through their steps, the visionaries orchestrating iconic festivals and nightclubs, and the strategic minds—whether businessmen or politicians—propelling the Bachata wave worldwide.

Every episode unfolds a rich tapestry, from tracing Bachata's historic roots and evolution to dissecting its timeless melodies. We bring you behind-the-scenes glimpses with festival organizers curating legendary events and club maestros setting unforgettable scenes. Our narratives aren’t just about dance or music—they encapsulate resilience, passion, and the impact Bachata has on global industries and politics.

PopiWa Podcasts is not just a viewing and listening voyage; it's a comprehensive Bachata education and celebration. Through our lens, witness the choreography of dance floors, the symphony of sounds, and the trailblazers shaping this dance revolution. Dive in, and let the multifaceted world of Bachata captivate your senses.

description: A thoughtful, researched, and slightly irreverent look at the most interesting players in our history.
